term.title: amidium ions

item.text: Cations formally derived by the addition of one hydron to the N or O atom of an amide and N-hydrocarbyl derivatives thereof. In organic chemistry an unspecified amidium ion is commonly a carboxamidium ion [image: Not defined] or [image: Not defined] The term does not imply knowledge concerning the position of the cationic centre, e.g. PhC(=O)N+Me3N,N,N-trimethylbenzamidium.
